intro: Miconia chiriquiensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí miconia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central America. It is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It is often found in humid lowland forests and is known for its rapid growth rate. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
